Portal 2 is fucking awesome. No seriously. In the 2 days it took me to complete Single Player (I'll add a part on the Cooperative Testing Initiative when I can convince my brother to stop playing Trove) I was **HOOKED**. I'm not gonna put any spoliers in this review and I recommend you don't go looking for them and just buy the damn game. One thing (which is really minor and will only effect 1% of players) is how pause is clicking the right stick on 360 controller, but only on the PC version (I have this game for the Xbox 360 aswell as I was playing through the CTI but I got stuck because my controller was fucked up (I've had the console since 2008)) which is a bit weird considering that was crouch in Portal 1, so I had to get used to it.

[h1]Portal 2[/h1]
Portal 2 is ALMOST THE SAME AS Portal 1 both being mainly a puzzle solving game, but not just a simple puzzle solving game Alongwith Portal 1 It has a beautifully written plot as well.This is a MUST BUY FOR EVERYONE I never liked puzzle games but after I played Portal 1 And Portal 2 my mind has changed towards puzzle solving games.These games are a GEM,ABSOLUTELY FLAWLESS I'll explain below what made me fall in love with this game though.

[b][u]Pros[/u][/b]
+Great gameplay
+Awesome Graphics(Way Ahead of its time)
+Rich storyline
+SDK Support 
+Custom Maps
+Advanced Levels
+More Challenges
+Built-In Level Editor
+Steam Workshop
+Coop Support
+Mod Support

Now to list the cons

[b][u]Cons[/u][/b]
[spoiler] NONE [/spoiler]

[b][u]Review/Final Verdict[/u][/b]
With everything listed above I can safely say it is worth buying although i got it with Valve Complete Pack but If I had to buy this separately I WOULD HAVE.
But... DON'T PLAY PORTAL 2 IF YOU HAVEN'T PLAY PORTAL 1 BEFORE

Portal 2 is a puzzle/platforming/action game where you fire portals at surfaces to complete a puzzle. As well as the titular portals, there are cubes, buttons, lasers and the new gels that you can play with to solve the test chambers left behind from the first game.

Pros:

- Hilarious writing that sounds great with the impressive voice acting.
- Tricky yet interesting puzzles that are just the right difficulty.
- A co-op mode that lets you work together/kill your friends with double the portals.
- Amazing soundtrack that you get for FREE when you buy the game, with over 60 tracks.

Cons:

- Felt a bit tedious at times.
- VALVE, Y U NO MAEK PORTAL 3.

Portal 2 is a worthy sequel to Valve's original series, and the modding community has allowed the game to continue interesting fans of gaming everywhere.

Probably the most involved you'll ever feel in a game. So far this is the most immersive puzzle game I've ever played, but don't get me wrong; it is not only a puzzle game. This was a good sequal to the first portal, keeping the old mchanics plus slowly introducing new ones. The additional story made the game more interesting and fun. My one complaint is in the non-test chamber segments you are required to find hidden portalable places, sometimes in the distance, in order to progress, resulting in boring frustration at times.
Exciting puzzle solving at its finest. What a great story line to follow in single player mode, the puzzles, the characters, and the graphics are all awesome :) Well worth the investment.

I wish Valve would quit messing around with operating systems and Steam machines and get back to developing Half Life 3 and Portal 3.

Chyba nie ma sensu rozpisywać się nad tą grą. Fenomen Portala 1 i 2 jest doskonale wszystkim znany, a Valve po raz kolejny pokazało klasę w wydawanych przez siebie grach. Wielu z Was śmieszy zapewne, że tak późno piszę recenzję do gry, która zdążyła się już pokryć sporą warstwą kurzu. Ano tak wyszło, gra jest dla mnie nowa, przechodzę ją dopiero pierwszy raz. Czemu? Otóż miałem inne tytuły na tapecie, odstraszał mnie zaś logiczny tryb gry. Szczerze, nie lubię gier zbyt logicznych, w których trzeba zadręczać szare komórki. Dlatego tak długo mi zeszło, a za grę sięgnąłem po prostu z nudów.

Opisywać Portala nie zamierzam. Nie ma sensu powtarzać to, co inni napisali już w "zamierzchłych" czasach. Wystarczy, że napomknę że gra mi się dość podobała. Czemu dość? No cóż, przysłowiowej dupy nie urywa. Owszem, gra się miło, szczególnie że po zaliczeniu pierwszej bardzo infantylnej i krótkiej części, gra przeszła dość spory lifting. Nadal jednak razi mnie niesamowicie uproszczona grafika. I nie mam na myśli słabą jakość, zdaję sobie sprawę że gra ma już swoje latka. Nie. To co mnie razi, to uboga i powtarzalna szata graficzna. Przyznam, że zamiast nudnych do bólu pomieszczeń i bliźniaczo do siebie podobnych, wolałbym poszaleć po jakiś wieżowcach, studniach, kanałach i nad rozmaitymi naturalnymi przepaściami. A tymczasem mamy białe ściany, ciemne ściany, woda - na palcach jednej ręki można policzyć rodzaje tekstur w Portalu.

Tak wiem, tu nie grafika jest ważna, ale same zagadki. I kolejna rzecz, brak stopniowania poziomu trudności. Gra jest niebywale łatwa, a niektóre pomieszczenia tak przewidywalne, że praktycznie Portal przechodzi się niemal sam. Może jednak zmienię zdanie, gdy grę przejdę w całości, wraz z misjami kooperacyjnymi. Póki co, jak wspomniałem - gra ciekawa i potrafi wciągnąć, ale jak dla mnie aż tak wielkim hitem nie będzie. Wolę jednak rozwalać niemiluchów, niż skakać przez niebieskie i pomarańczowe dziury. Niemniej polecam miłośnikom łamigłówek, chociaż łba to sobie tutaj zbytnio nie połamiecie. No, chyba że ktoś ma naprawdę toporne myślenie, ale to już pozostawiam pod indywidualny osąd.

A sequel from 2011 to the [i]Portal[/i] (2007) phenomena it expands on its predecessor in every way. New elements, such as different substances affecting movement and beams moving objects through air, are introduced to variate the physics puzzles even more. It is challenging and fun all the way! You can play it as a standalone game but it will be so much more rewarding if you play it as intended.
Puzzle perfeito

♪ Say something I'm giving up on you ♪

Ho giocato allegramente il primo capitolo, il primo portal e mi è piaciuto abbastanza per l'originalità e la difficoltà, la grafica mi faceva soffrire un po', ma tutto sommato era bello. 
Ora ho finito il secondo.
Spesso definisco i giochi migliori come arte, Portal 2 è arte, assieme ad altri titoli meravigliosi come Bioshock, Dishonored, Deus Ex.
All'inizio del gioco mi sono fatto una promessa: non devo guardare nessun video di walktrough. Al finale mi sono sentito soddisfatto perché avevo finito tutte le sfide solo con pazienza e ingegno. Posso dire che Portal è il rompicapo per eccellenza, devi uscire da una stanza, basta, nient'altro, l'obbiettivo e sempre lo stesso, hai in mano una pistola per portali e devi farne uso. 
Portal 2 è un Portal più ricco, più florido dal punto di vista grafico e narrativo. Poi alla fine è sempre uguale: distruggere l'intelligenza artificiale malvagia. Portal 2 ha una storia più complessa del primo, più emozionante e intricata. In più si può giocare in cooperativa (divertente con gli amici) e si possono creare le proprie sfide e poi provarle per vedere se funzionano.
E' uscito fuori un gioco eccezionale, un must buy per tutti. Dopo averci giocato capirete che il mondo funziona in portali blu e arancioni.
The cake is still a lie.
